intro: Escallonia stenophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf escallonia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and clusters of fragrant, pink or white flowers. It typically grows in coastal areas and thrives in well-drained soils. Escallonia stenophylla is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to tolerate salt spray.
